topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Changing the DNS Server Configuration

body.p: You can change the DNS servers defined for the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade at any time after installation. During software installation, the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is configured with up to two DNS server IP addresses.
body.note: This feature applies only to KVM Region servers.

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System Configuration panel.

Click the DNS tab.
The DNS page displays the currently defined DNS servers and their IP addresses.
In the Edit DNS dialog box, replace the DNS Server IP addresses with different ones as required.

Click Save.
Upon completion of the DNS configuration change, a 250.001 Configuration out-of-date alarm is raised temporarily, and then cleared automatically by the system..

body.p: For more information on system configuration, see the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Administrator Guide.
